New Records: Brice Sensabaugh scored a game-high 27 points on Sunday, including going 5-of-6 from 3-point range.
Key Match Events: Brice Sensabaugh led the Jazz to victory for the second night in a row
The Jazz improved to 9-25 on the season with their win over the Magic
Pre-Game Insights: The Jazz were shorthanded with injuries to several key players, including Lauri Markkanen, Jordan Clarkson, Keyonte George, and John Collins
The Magic have been a steadily rising and increasingly impressive team that seemed ready to cement themselves as one of the best teams in the Eastern Conference
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz head coach Will Hardy praised Brice Sensabaugh's consistency and confidence, saying 'I thought it was a big step for him, his confidence, his belief in the work that heâ€™s doing, to have this kind of game two nights in a row'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz are gunning for one of the three worst records in the league to improve their chances at a top pick in the NBA draft
The Magic's best players have been hit with injuries, including Paulo Banchero, Franz Wagner, and Jalen Suggs
Others: The Jazz's young players, including Collin Sexton, Walker Kessler, Micah Potter, Johnny Juzang, and Isaiah Collier, played key roles in the win
